intro: Neopanax laetus, commonly known as the Hawaiian net-veined palm, is a flowering plant species native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, net-veined leaves that give it its common name. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its flowers are small and clustered in inflorescences, and it produces drupes that are dispersed by birds. Neopanax laetus is of significant ecological importance in its native habitat, contributing to the biodiversity of Hawaiian forests.
